intro: Acosta derventana, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are adapted to conserve water in hot, dry environments. Acosta derventana typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. It produces small, round berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals and wind.
